page.title: 18S.P.A.C.E. Ride- Alstonfield
page.content:
One morning I woke up and got dressed and ate a big bowl, in fact a very big bowl of cornflakes. I'd only just found out that it was throwing it down with rain. I'm going on a bike ride today. It's called S.P.A.C.E. and it's organised by the police.
I told my mum that it was raining so she rang Jim Fradley, one of the police for Warslow. He said to come up to the school. They were getting ready to come down to the grit pit. We'd just set off and it started to you know what, it was pouring down. We got to Waterhouses, had our dinner under a tree when a thunder bolt came straight through. We ran down the bank and ran straight to the cars, and dried ourselves. What an end to a bike ride.
